website_summaries.verdict: A great basic cutter that's good for cutting single coroplast layers with the flutes. It's not intended, however, for cutting across the flutes.
pros: Get a better grip with this ergonomic handle design
Cuts easily along flutes as well as full or partial sheets
Easily makes an inside or outside bend
Can make a box or column by cutting three corners
Makes it easy to cut straight
cons: Designed for cutting with the flutes, not across flutes
Does not work as well going through double layers

customer_reviews.title: Works the same
customer_reviews.text: This tool is only really effective for cutting along the ‘grain’ of corrugated plastic it does not work well when cutting against the grain. I think this is probably good if you are not comfortable using a utility but a utility knife is just as, if not more effective. Also the area that accommodates the corrugated plastic is not very wide so either you would have to buy another blade for thicker plastic or buy another tool. Overall if you have a utility knife and are comfortable using it. You do not need this.
customer_reviews.author: kellymvy

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: I was able to cut coroplast sheets all the way through, or halfway through, just as it should. Did not use it to cut cross grain since it not really made to do that. Used your basic box cutter for that.
customer_reviews.author: ActionSpeaksLouder

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool to Have for Coroplast Projects
customer_reviews.text: Works as described! I had made my guinea pig C&C cage without using this tool and on certain sections had cut through instead of scoring the coroplast. Won't have that happening again. Tested out on several spare pieces of coroplast after receiving and this cutter worked beautifully. Looking forward to creating my cage loft with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t cut against the grain.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly if cutting down the line. You do have to cut each side. If you try to cut against the grain, it doesn’t really work.
customer_reviews.author: NickF

customer_reviews.title: It does the job but could be more sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. Only gets 4 stars because I feel like it isn’t as sturdy as it could be, but works nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hilzendeger

customer_reviews.title: Fast, smooth cutting through the ribs--not across them.
customer_reviews.text: Great for cutting along the ribs. (Wished they made something for cutting across the ribs.)
customer_reviews.author: C.V. Sharkey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, straight cuts
customer_reviews.text: Makes clean, straight cuts on coroplast. Much better than a knife + straightedge! We should have purchased these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: A44966

customer_reviews.title: Sign shop must-have!
customer_reviews.text: I work with coroplast daily, it's a pain to cut but this tool makes it easy! The grip is much more comfortable than another style I have seen and used. Saves so much time!
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannon Ieraci

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: This tool really does save time and money not having to waste sign blanks due to cutting them awkward
customer_reviews.author: Eathan

customer_reviews.title: Broke within two cuts
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product understanding is a cheaper version of the really nice one for a higher price. However within 2 cuts the cutting blades broke right off. Just cutting lexan sheet
customer_reviews.author: Richard Thomas

customer_reviews.title: This works great going through the single layer but not so good ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great going through the single layer but not so good on the double layers. I use lots of different thickness of the Coroplast signs, and this works best on the lighter weight board. (recycled political signs being repurposed)
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl A. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We were cutting coroplast by hand before running across this item. This is a great time saver when cutting coro lengthwise. It is not made for cutting across the flutes but for cutting long lengths with the flutes it is great. You can even cut just one layer so you can bend it at angles for interesting signage uses.
customer_reviews.author: Wags

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Must have for working with corrugated plastic! Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect, love how it cuts and score would recommend to anyone.this is the 1st one I have bought and never regretted it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: don't know why I didn't buy this years ago. So much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for scoring coroplast for guinea pig cages
customer_reviews.text: This tool makes it so much easier to score coroplast. I'm always rebuilding my guinea pig cage so I've decided to invest in this tool. I should have gotten it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Lis

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool for coroplast work but remember this only cut with the cord channel not acrossed the cord channels.
customer_reviews.author: Paulds7

customer_reviews.title: Dull
customer_reviews.text: This particular cutter was far duller than the one I lost. Price is ok, but dull.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: A tool that just makes it easy
customer_reviews.text: This tool made my hours of previous cutting seem like a waste of time. I love this item and plan on using it for a long time in my set designs. Check out youtube for simple uses and see for yourself that it is just that good.
customer_reviews.author: HPBC Tech Director

customer_reviews.title: It works (but not for long)
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for cutting coroplast until the blade snapped in two on my 25th cut. I was very disappointed in the quality of the Coro-Claw.
customer_reviews.author: DLB

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool for stage designers!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect tool to use when cutting coroplast material down the “flutes.” Just lock it in and slide it, and you’re good to go! We stripped a LOT of pieces to make for a stage design at a venue, worked like a charm! If you ever THINK you might need one, just order it now so you won’t be without!
customer_reviews.author: hunter

customer_reviews.title: you don't get what's pictured
customer_reviews.text: This is not what is in the picture! There is no "blade" it's a piece of cheap metal with "groves" ground into it
customer_reviews.author: C Baker

customer_reviews.title: Safe and Easy
customer_reviews.text: This tool cuts coroplast like butter. It is almost impossible for it to injure the user. The blades are tucked away. I have seen it advertised for 10 times the price.
customer_reviews.author: L G Bingham

customer_reviews.title: Fast Delivery
customer_reviews.text: Showed up almost a week before it was slotted to arrive. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Stephani Miller

product_meta.title: Saw Trax CCD4 Coro-Claw 4mm Coroplast Cutter
product_meta.description: 4 Mll flute cutter, cut or score 4 Mil fluted material, patented design - so easy and comfortable to use.
feature_bullets: Ergonomically handle design allows user to get a better grip
Almost half the cost of other flute cutter on the market
Easily cut along flutes of full or partial sheets
Make an inside or outside bend easily
Make a box or column by cutting three corners

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars82 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
